docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 24--Yugoslavia complained tonight before the United Nations Subcommission on Freedom of Information and the Press that Czechoslovakia was holding Radislav Bayagitch, a correspondent for the Yugoslav news agency Tanyug, a "virtual prisoner."

docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 25--The question of President Juan D. Peron's press policy in Argentina, which has been in the minds of most delegates to the United Nations Subcommission on Freedom of Information and the Press here, will come up for discussion tomorrow.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 26--A resolution deploring Government intervention in the distribution of newsprint and asking "an end to confiscatory measures as being contrary to freedom of the press" was adopted this morning by the United Nations...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 26--A resolution deploring Government intervention in the distribution of newsprint and asking "an end to confiscatory measures as being contrary to freedom of the press" was adopted this morning by the United Nations Subcommission on Freedom of Information and the Press. The vote was 10 to 0, with the Yugoslav expert abstaining.
